titlePart.supplied: Address to the New Jersey Birth Control League

sourceDesc.bibl: Mrs. Sanger Speaks Here, Newark Star Eagle, Nov. 01, 1932

headNote.p: Sanger spoke to 200 members of the New Jersey Birth Control League at a housewarming reception for its new Maternal Health Center in Newark. Others appearning included Henrietta Hart and Hannah Mayer Stone. No draft version of these remarks were found, the text here comes from Newark Star Eagle November 1, 1932.

docBody.head: Mrs. Sanger Speaks Here
Urges N.J Clinic to Aid Happiness of Families.
docBody.p: “I want you also to ask the heads of your institutions for the incompetent what they are doing to help cut down the need for the appalling bill for the maintenance of these institutions,” Mrs. Sanger pleaded.

div.head: Early Marriage
div.p: Although she said she believes in early marriage, especially in hard times, because a young couple can live together more cheaply than apart, Mrs. Sanger opposes the early assumption of the responsibility of children. “There would be fewer divorces among young people,” she said, “If they could have at least two years to get really acquainted with each other and to have fun together before the children came.”
